1565795636_1KUSKrffaR1sfLwxZUXUPshLpKhh5.body:
> [bvcfbfbcbcvd](#comment_29_1KUSKrffaR1sfLwxZUXUPshLpKhh5PXWm7): Disabling the proxy in Tor Browser will turn it into a normal Firefox, won't it? That sounds like a horrible advice...

Actually not at all : what's been advised here is _only_ to turn it off for 127.0.0.1. Which means it'll only stop using (or, better, attempting to use) TOR for ... your own computer.

BUT if a (rogue) zite tries to redirect you to clearnet, at least you'll be reaching clearnet through TOR.

1570061009_1DMTYjzfkFHyB8yZ37sMBuTirTUp5.body: As said on ZeroMe, there's also ZeroBulles : http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ZBULLEquJGBAUeRurdg9iXnXsDYQVE4y/
